awd_titl_txt: Nb3Al Superconducting Wire Using an Al-Alloy/Nb Jelly-Roll  Processing Technique
awd_abstract_narration: The feasibility of fabricating Nb3Al multifilamentary                           superconducting wires through a Jelly-Roll technique using                      commercially available aluminum alloy sheets, which contain Mg                  and/or Si, will be investigated.  Oxygen free high conductivity                 copper will be incorporated into the conductor design as the                    stabilizer.  The conventional wire fabricating processes with low               temperature extrusion will be tested.  The superconducting                      properties of the new materials such as Tc or Jc will be measured.              The microstructures of the superconducting composite materials will             be examined and characterized.  The aim is to develop a                         superconducting wire with properties that exceed those of current               materials.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships
